summary: TriSynk Core defines a deterministic multi-frontend language focused on AI agents and cross-ecosystem reuse.
Core specification covers semantic kernel, unified type/effect system, clmr MLIR dialect, ABI, runtime, and tooling requirements.
Architecture blueprint enumerates layer stack, agent loop, modules, data flows, and safety controls.
Roadmap schedules phases from bootstrap through hardening with issue references and success criteria.
Issue graph links numbered ISS tasks to document anchors ensuring traceable execution.
Intent DSL defines YAML schema, workflow, and validation rules for agent-driven development.
Reference intent for ISS-003 demonstrating required metadata, constraints, verification hooks, and telemetry SLOs.
Batch validator that enforces schema compliance for every intent YAML via .agents/tools/intent_schema.py.
Ensures each ISS section in docs/issues.md contains scope/deliverables/dependencies and anchors to documentation.
CI pipeline running baseline checks, intent linting, and issue validation on push/PR.
Parses docs/issues.md and intents/*.yaml into a unified JSON graph for automation.
Current issue+intent export consumed by Git Projects automation.
Reads exported graph and prepares/creates GitHub Issues with linked intents.
Documents required env vars (GITHUB_REPO, GITHUB_TOKEN) for automation scripts.
Defines operating charter for TriSynk agents: mission, workflow, tools, prohibitions.
Outlines trisynk-rs/cpp prototypes, shared ABI contracts, and testing roadmap.
Guards coverage/performance targets using reports/metrics.json.
Current placeholder coverage/perf metrics (>=85%, <=5% delta) for CI gating.
Nightly/dispatch workflow pushing docs/issues into GitHub using sync_issues.py.
Prototype Rust frontend converting sample code into clmr-like JSON.
Prototype C++ frontend emitting ABI metadata and function lists.
Runs both frontends against sample sources to ensure JSON output.
Executes frontend smoke tests and regenerates reports/metrics.json for CI thresholds.
Locally generated token enabling sync scripts to run --apply in mock mode.
Latest payload produced by sync_issues.py --apply --repo local, ready for GitHub ingestion.
Runs trisynk-rs/cpp prototypes and validates emitted JSON before CI.
